page.title: 04FARMING AROUND SOUTHWELL (1)
page.content: On the{farms}around Southwell you will find that the main{crops}growing in the fields at{harvest}time are peas, potatoes, oil seed rape, wheat and barley. The two main crops growing out of these are wheat and barley. Farmers grow different crops in different fields each year, so as not to take too many nutrients out of the soil. This rotational system is used all over the country, and keeps the land in good condition. For example; a farmer has three fields, one growing rape seed, one growing wheat and the other growing barley - we will call these fields one,two and three. After harvest, the crop in field one is transferred to field two. Field two's crop transferred to field three and field three's crop transferred to field one.
